channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge rules immigration officers in Minneapolis can't detain peaceful protesters
item.description: Officers in the Minneapolis-area participating in a U.S. immigration enforcement operation can't detain or tear gas peaceful protesters who aren't obstructing authorities, a judge ruled Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Officers in the Minneapolis-area participating in a U.S. immigration enforcement operation can't detain or tear gas peaceful protesters who aren't obstructing authorities, a judge ruled Friday.

(Image credit: John Locher)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: No sign of new protests in Iran as a hard-line cleric calls for executions
item.description: A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
A Iran returns to an uneasy calm after protests led to a violent crackdown, a senior cleric is calling for the death penalty for detained demonstrators. His sermon Friday also threatened U.S. President Trump.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ICE surge sparks fear and resistance in Minneapolis
item.description: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.content:encoded: Minneapolis residents are resisting as federal immigration agents surge into their city, creating what some locals describe as an atmosphere of fear and siege on the streets.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Major California highway re-opens after three-year closure
item.description: A section of an iconic California highway has reopened after three years. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rhea Withrow, who lives in a town that was isolated during the closure
item.content:encoded: A section of an iconic California highway has reopened after three years. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rhea Withrow, who lives in a town that was isolated during the closure
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: It took 75 governors to elect a woman. Spanberger will soon be at Virginia's helm
item.description: Abigail Spanberger, a former CIA officer and three-term congresswoman, is breaking long-held traditions on inauguration day. She says she wants her swearing-in to showcase the state's modern vibrancy.
item.content:encoded:
Abigail Spanberger, a former CIA officer and three-term congresswoman, is breaking long-held traditions on inauguration day. She says she wants her swearing-in to showcase the state's modern vibrancy.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Barthel

item.title: For those with addiction, going into and coming out of prison can be a minefield.
item.description: Many jails and prisons around the country don't provide medication treatment for opioid use disorder. Studies show that medication makes recovery more likely and reduces the risk of overdose death.
item.content:encoded:
Many jails and prisons around the country don't provide medication treatment for opioid use disorder. Studies show that medication makes recovery more likely and reduces the risk of overdose death.

(Image credit: Ash Adams for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cassandra

item.title: Trump threatens military action in Minneapolis. And, inside his healthcare plan
item.description: President Trump threatens to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minnesota to stop protests happening in Minneapolis. And, the president unveils what he calls a new healthcare plan.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump threatens to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minnesota to stop protests happening in Minneapolis. And, the president unveils what he calls a new healthcare plan.

(Image credit: Octavio Jones)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump threatens to use the Insurrection Act to stop anti-ICE protests in Minneapolis
item.description: President Trump has threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minneapolis to quell ongoing protests against ICE, but local leaders say it's the White House that's escalating the situation.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minneapolis to quell ongoing protests against ICE, but local leaders say it's the White House that's escalating the situation.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Trump threatened to invoke the Insurrection Act in Minneapolis. What that would mean
item.description: What would it mean for President Trump to invoke the Insurrection Act to quell protests in Minneapolis? NPR's A Martinez asks Liza Goitein of the Brennan Center for Justice.
item.content:encoded: What would it mean for President Trump to invoke the Insurrection Act to quell protests in Minneapolis? NPR's A Martinez asks Liza Goitein of the Brennan Center for Justice.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: What do eggs, Grok and Greenland have in common? They're all quiz-worthy! Are you?
item.description: See if you can get a perfect score for once.
item.content:encoded:
See if you can get a perfect score for once.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck/AFP via Getty Images; Michael Loccisano/Getty Images; Frazer Harrison/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris
